text: Care workers in France are being rewarded with a £1,500 tax-free lump sum.

claimReview.title: Many French care workers will get a tax-free bonus of up to £1,340 for working during the pandemic - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Care home workers in France will get a tax-free bonus of up to €1,500 (£1,340) if they worked during the pandemic in the most affected areas. Those in less affected regions will get up to €1,000 (£890).

claimReview.title: Viral claim about France’s tax-free health care workers bonus needs context - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Care workers in nursing homes will get a bonus, but it’s not yet clear how much. Healthcare staff fighting Covid-19 will get €1,500 (£1,300). Other hospital staff will get €500 (£440).

text: On fabric it can survive for 6-12 hours. normal laundry detergent will kill it.

claimReview.title: List of symptoms and how to prevent the new coronavirus contains inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence yet that the virus can survive in clothing and be transmitted this way. Any soiled clothing should be thoroughly washed.

text: To test for the new coronavirus, take a deep breath and hold for more than 10 seconds. If you complete it successfully without coughing, discomfort, stuffiness or tightness it proves there is no fibrosis in the lungs, basically indicating no infection.

text: Wash your hands frequently as the virus can only live on your hands for 5-10 minutes.

claimReview.title: Viral posts sharing symptoms and treatments for Covid-19 contain false information - Full Fact

text: If you have a runny nose and sputum, you have a common cold, not Covid-19.

claimReview.textualRating: These are the symptoms for the common cold, but they don’t rule out Covid-19.

text: Absolute poverty and relative poverty have both declined under this government.

claimReview.title: Boris Johnson incorrect to say Keir Starmer is “completely wrong” about past trends in child poverty - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Government figures show that relative low income was at the same level in 2018/19 as in 2009/10 while absolute low income fell by one percentage point. Another measure of poverty, produced by the Social Metrics Commission, does show a fall under this government.

claimReview.title: Child poverty: Boris Johnson's claims fact-checked
claimReview.textualRating: Relative poverty has increased since 2009-10 while absolute poverty has declined. But Boris Johnson has only been PM since July 2019 and we do not have figures to compare since his government began.

text: If the new coronavirus gets into your mouth, drinking water or other liquids will wash them down through the oesophagus. Once they’re in the stomach, the acid will kill the virus. If you don't drink enough water more regularly, the virus can enter your windpipes and into the lungs.

claimReview.title: Holding your breath is not an indicator of whether you have the new coronavirus, and drinking water doesn’t protect against it - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Drinking water does not prevent an infection and there have been cases where the virus has survived in the stomach and affected people’s intestines.

claimReview.title: List of symptoms and how to prevent the new coronavirus contains inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: This is incorrect. Drinking water does not prevent an infection.

text: Coronavirus pneumonia is a dry cough with no runny nose.

claimReview.title: Viral posts sharing symptoms and treatments for Covid-19 contain false information - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some Covid-19 patients do get pneumonia, and one of the symptoms is a dry cough. A runny nose doesn’t rule out Covid-19.

claimReview.title: Viral post about someone’s uncle’s coronavirus advice is not all it’s cracked up to be - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: Some Covid-19 patients do get pneumonia, and one of the symptoms is a dry cough. A runny nose doesn’t rule out Covid-19.

claimReview.textualRating: Some Covid-19 patients do get pneumonia, and one of the symptoms is a dry cough. A runny nose doesn’t rule out Covid-19.

text: This new virus is not heat-resistant and will be killed by a temperature of just 26/27 degrees. It hates the Sun.

claimReview.title: Viral post about someone’s uncle’s coronavirus advice is not all it’s cracked up to be - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence for this. There’s evidence that similar viruses transmit less well in the heat, but many countries with reported Covid-19 cases are experiencing temperatures higher than this.

claimReview.title: List of symptoms and how to prevent the new coronavirus contains inaccuracies - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence for this. There’s evidence that similar viruses transmit less well in the heat, but many countries with reported Covid-19 cases are experiencing temperatures higher than this.

text: Drinking warm water is effective for all viruses. Try not to drink liquids with ice.

claimReview.title: Viral posts sharing symptoms and treatments for Covid-19 contain false information - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence that the temperature of liquids consumed can protect you from viruses.

claimReview.title: Viral post about someone’s uncle’s coronavirus advice is not all it’s cracked up to be - Full Fact
claimReview.textualRating: There’s no evidence that the temperature of liquids consumed can either protect you from or cure diseases caused by viruses.
